subject: Re: [junit] GUI unit testing
msgSnippet: ... Suppose the code in question consists of drawing on a canvas of some kind. Could you test-drive computing the drawing instructions, even if not executing
messageBody:
Altman, Joel G. (JSC-CC)[LM] wrote:

> One senior developer to whom I gave the task of developing the graphical
> portion of the user interface says there is no way to use JUnit on his
> code. I believe it can be done, but I haven't found anything in JUnit
> Recipes I can use to convince him.
>
> Can somebody give me ammunition for this task? What would be the best
> method for unit testing graphics code?

Suppose the code in question consists of drawing on a canvas of some
kind. Could you test-drive computing the drawing instructions, even if
not executing those instructions? I imagine computing the drawing
instructions is most of the value of that code, anyway.

I hope that helps.
